definitions: To gain a point or goal in a game or competition.
To make a mark or incision on a surface.
To obtain or acquire something, especially illegally or with difficulty.
To arrange or compose music for a film, play, etc.
examples: He managed to score a goal in the final minute.
She hoped to score a good deal on the car.
Score the paper before folding it.
The band will score the new movie.
He tried to score some drugs.
